title: [Large-Scale] Interdisciplinary Service Learning in Biochemistry and Biology: Mobile-Based Intensive Short-Term Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic biochemistry and biology knowledge, fundamental laboratory skills
context.additional_context: Service-learning projects linked to job roles, engaging in solving real-world industry problems

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively measure hormone concentrations in actual biological samples by applying the ELISA biochemical assay
Learners create portfolios that effectively communicate research outcomes to non-technical stakeholders through collaboration with service recipient organizations

Learners can select three customer service skills (e.g., active listening, empathetic responses) acquired through service learning, write a one-page action plan (including target audience, timing, and methods) for applying each skill in the workplace, and receive an 80%+ feasibility evaluation from team feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
